Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2019 09:31AM Motheroftwo36 wrote: just had biopsy, that was rough! They did two separate biopsies. One ultrasound guided biopsy near my nipple which stung really bad and then s stereotactic biopsy and I didn’t feel anything but i bled like crazy! I was covered in my blood and it took 30 minutes to stop it. It still bleeds when I move. Ugh.. I’ll have results on Monday
Posts.Title: Age 32 and Large mass in right breast Motheroftwo36 Marymc86

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2019 10:25AM Motheroftwo36 wrote: After speaking with surgeon and oncologist, they both agreed a double mastectomy is the way to go and i agree. Im young and the amount of monitoring i would have to go through is not desirable. The team i am working with is wonderful. So thankful for that. The surgeon said the lump is too close to my nipple so nipple sparing isnt an option anyway, thats a big bummer but like several of yall said, it wouldnt be the same anyway. Surgeon also discussed how the tissue doesnt always "take" so that sound horrible. They still dont know if my cancer is DCIS or not. The additional staining that was done still didnt rule it out. Oncologist said that will be determined after surgery as djmammo had told me. So hoping its all DCIS and i will be done with this after surgery. Chemo scares the crap out of me.
Posts.Title: Age 32 and Large mass in right breast Motheroftwo36 Marymc86

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2019 11:49AM Motheroftwo36 wrote: so nurse called and scheduled a biopsy. She said report didn’t have much details. Something about calcifications and lymph node. I’m going to pick up my report later today.
Posts.Title: Age 32 and Large mass in right breast Motheroftwo36 Marymc86

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2019 04:05PM Motheroftwo36 wrote: so I went and picked up my report since no one was giving me any information. The reports are way less scary than my imagination! No cysts or solid mass found. Normal lymph nodes. Lots of calcifications though that appear benign in mammogram but suspicious on ultrasound.  I don’t know why that wasn’t explained to me! Makes me angry! But I’m relieved that it doesn’t sound that bad.
Posts.Title: Age 32 and Large mass in right breast Motheroftwo36 Marymc86

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2019 05:21AM Motheroftwo36 wrote: thanks everyone! I do feel better and it’s great advice to just play with my kiddos today. W are all getting over some virus too so we can’t do much anyway. The doctor mentioning “doing something about it” regardless of results. ( this was before she even felt it) she said it could just take away breast tissue. If this thing is removed I’ll seriously only have half a boob. I have small boobs and this thing takes up like a third of it . Hoping tomorrow they can tell it’s something benign and we can just leave it there. Or it’ll go away on its own? Hopeful thinking I know. Thanks again ladies, it helps to just get it out. Enjoy your Sunday

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2019 04:34PM Motheroftwo36 wrote: blah333 My birads was 0 because they needed the ultrasound. The ultrasound didn’t have a rating and it just said suspicious. The surgeon said the calcifications had a suspicious pattern but she didn’t say what the pattern was. The ultrasound said numerous locations of innumerable calcifications. So to me that means cluster but I don’t know. Researching has been helpful but most of it is a waste of time. I’m trying now to do any research but before all this i was clueless about cancer types so it’s good to at least be knowledgeable. The lumps though she isn’t concerned about. Buffalowing... Good luck and let me know results! How was biopsy? I hate u have to go through this AGAIN. What a nightmare. On a good note, I rescheduled my biopsy with a different hospital and will go this Friday. I have to go pick up my images though since the hospital won’t send it.

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2019 05:43AM Motheroftwo36 wrote: thanks everyone! It’s nice to hear others experiences. Unfortunately I don’t think I can get away from mastectomy because more than half of my boob has these calcifications. I have smaller breasts also so there won’t be much tissue left. I’m interested in nipple sparing but I have a lump right behind my nipple so not being too hopeful there. I should have lots of answers today. I wish they could do the mri while I’m there but that’ll be another thing to have to schedule. But hearing from most of y’all it seems the average wait is 1 month to 1.5 months so that’s not too bad I guess. Looks like it’ll fall right around my birthday. :/ I’m actually pretty calm about this for some reason. It doesn’t seem real. Just hoping for no invasion. Not sure if that even makes a difference though so I’ll be having it all removed.

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2019 05:17AM Motheroftwo36 wrote: buffalowings  Such good news! And what a frightening experience!! I’m living with no direction as to what my odds are and the doctors aren’t saying one way or another either. Yesterday I had another ultrasound before my biopsy and the tech was wonderful. She explained everything she saw. I asked if she sees this much in my age and she said no it’s very uncommon. So either way I’m riding the uncommon boat with you! I’m almost 33. The calcifications I have go from nipple all the way to arm pit. Tons of them. Very tiny powdery like. Probably run about 1.5 inch wide in a line. Some areas are more dense then others. Only on one breast. So bizarre.

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2019 05:10PM Motheroftwo36 wrote: so I thought today I was having a biopsy. It’s been 7 days since my mammogram and ultrasound. I got to doctor who examined me and then said she recommended a biopsy. I was like, yeah well that’s why I’m here! And she said no that she has to schedule it. I broke down because I thought I was almost done and would get answers. She scheduled my biopsy for this coming Thursday and then calls me once I get home and has a conflict so she pushed it even further to the next week on Wednesday!! I’m so mad at this process! Why should it take a month to find out? Why are there so many steps and nothing can be done together?? Why does it take a radiologist, my OB and a surgeon to all recommend a biopsy before I can schedule it?? Gosh im frustrated! So from the exam she told me that the mass I can feel, the nipple discharge and the calcifications are all unrelated! I find it so hard to believe that the lumps aren’t related when the calcifications are in same spot! I said well when I push this lump, fluid comes out and she just said it’s normal. This is not normal!! I’m so confused. She said the mass feels like fibrocystic disease but she couldn’t say for sure what it is.She is only concerned with the micro calcifications and the pattern of them. I just don’t see how this can be unrelated with such a big coincidence.

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2019 07:54PM Motheroftwo36 wrote: I’m sorry you are going through this. I have a double mastectomy planned next month and I’m sure we are all emotional at that stage. Just seeing ourselves in a different way is emotional enough. I hope u have lots of support. I’m 32 and have two toddlers and never did I imagine I’d be going through this. I try to look at the positive though. So thankful for how treatable breast cancer is now, new boobs aren’t necessarily a horrible thing (in my case) , and pretty soon this will just be a memory that can only make u stronger. Lots of love and reach out whenever u need it.

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2019 02:29AM Motheroftwo36 wrote: I’m getting tissue expander too. The TE is either placed under or over muscle just as the implant is. The actual implant exchange is a much quicker recovery. I would suggest u call your plastic surgeon and ask him those questions.
